intro: Piptandra spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved piper, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features lanceolate to ovate leaves that are usually hairy and have a strong, peppery aroma. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elliptical, fleshy fruits. Its leaves and fruits contain essential oils and are used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory properties. Piptandra spathulata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
